div.bibl: The Chicago Jewish Chronicle, Volume 22. Wk. of January 1, 1932. p. 1.

body.p: The needs of Chicago for the relief of the unemployed was estimated by Samuel A. Goldsmith, executive director of the Jewis Charities of Chicago, at $25,000,000 for the year of 1932, at a hearing before the La Follette Senate Sub-Committee on unemployment. Mr. Goldsmith estimated that 1/3 of the population of Illinois is out of work.
Mr. Goldsmith said that it was essential that federal unemployment relief be extended.
